did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle:
State Council of Higher Education for Virginia. Office of the Director. Subject and Correspondence Files,
1974-1997

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: State Council of Higher Education for Virginia. Office of the Director. Subject and Correspondence files, 1974-1997. Accession 36681. State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: The State Council of Higher Education for Virginia was created by an act of the General Assembly on March 10, 1956, to act as the state's coordinating and advising body for institutions of higher education. The purpose of the Council is to promote the development and operation of an educationally and economically sound, vigorous, progressive, and coordinated system of education in the Commonwealth. Among the Council's significant responsibilities are: to develop a master plan for higher education and to conduct other planning activities; to establish guidelines for operating and capital outlay budgets of the institutions of higher education and to review and to make recommendations on budget requests to the Governor and General Assembly; to approve changes in institutional missions; to approve any new degree programs; to terminate non-productive degree programs; approve enrollment projections of the institutions; to grant approval to in-state, private institutions to confer degrees; to involve the private and proprietary institutions to confer degrees; to involve the private and proprietary institutions in the state's overall planning for postsecondary institutions in the state's overall planning for postsecondary education; to administer statewide student financial assistance programs; to provide guidelines for determining the domiciliary residence of students applying for in-state tuition rates; to establish and revise, as necessary, guidelines for patent and copyright policies developed by the public institutions; to coordinate the continuing education offerings of the public institutions; and to develop guidelines for the assessment of student achievement. The Council consists of eleven members appointed by the governor, subject to confirmation by the General Assembly.

Dr. Gordon K. Davies served as the Assistant Director of SCHEV from 1974 to 1977 and Director of SCHEV from 1977-1997. Dr. Davies is credited with having guided the state-supported institutions within the Commonwealth of Virginia to new levels of excellence. His tenure as Director ended in April 1997 when the Council voted to not renew his contract. The Council's move to release Dr. Davies was controversial and prompted the resignation of several Council members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Comprised of the administrative papers of Dr. Gordon K. Davies, Director of the State Council of Higher Education (SCHEV), 1977-1997. Contains correspondence, speeches, publications, reports, newsclippings and other materials related to Dr. Davies' activities as director. Also included in the collection is documentation regarding his activities outside of SCHEV as a member of the Desegregation Settlement Compliance Committee for the Louisiana Board of Regents, an evaluator of the Kentucky Centers of Excellence and Endowed Chairs, and as a member of a National Governor's Association group that travelled to Nepal to study the institutions of higher education in that country. Documentation regarding the working dynamics of the agency are primarily found in electronic correspondence.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: I. Correspondence; II. Speeches and writings; III. External activities; IV. Termination as Director of SCHEV; V. Gordon K. Davies; and VI. Miscellaneous Materials.

did.unittitle:
Series I: Correspondence,
1975-1997

arrangement.p: Divided into three (3) subseries: General Correspondence; Electronic Correspondence; and Letters of Reference. All correspondence is arranged chronologically, and are described individually.

did.unittitle:
Subseries 1: General Correspondence,
1975-1997

arrangement.p: Arrange chronologically by date. Contains routine correspondence regarding issues in higher education as well as correspondence regarding Dr. Davies' speaking engagements.

Subseries 2: Electronic Correspondence, 1986-1995 (bulk 1987-1989)

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by the beginning date of the messages in the printout. Contains local area network (LAN) messages on the PROFS system as well as electronci mail (e-mail) with individuals outside SCHEV and institutions of higher education in the Commonwealth. Some printouts overlap in date and content, and some printouts are incomplete. Some messages have been blocked out due to privacy-protected subjects, resulting in blank spots on some pages.

Subseries 3: Letters of Reference,
1985-1996

scopecontent.p: Contains letters and resumes of individuals requesting that Dr. Davies be a reference for job-seeking purposes. Some return correspondence from Dr. Davies is also included. Correspondence is generally grouped by individual and arranged chronologically. Some items have been removed or have had sections blocked out due to privacy issues. The last folder of this series contains requests from Dr. Davies requesting references for and responses to nominations for his own employment searches.

Series II: Speeches and Writings,
1974-1997

arrangement.p: Arranged into four (4) subseries: Speeches given by Dr. Davies; Speeches given by others; Writings and Publications; and Source Materials. Items are arranged chronologically within each series. Each subseries is described individually.

did.unittitle:
Subseries 1: Speeches given by Dr. Davies,
1975-1997

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by date of event. Includes remarks made at convocations and commencements at state-supported institutions throughout the Commonwealth; speeches made at professional conferecnes, meetings of community organizations; and other events. Source materials for speeches are located in Series IV.

Subseries 2: Speeches given by others,
1977-1992

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically within folders. Contains speeches given by members of the SCHEV staff and members of Virginia government, as well as other individuals. Some of the speeches were written by Dr. Davies for others, although authorship is not always stated.

Speeches given by others,
1978-1992

Subseries 3: Writings and Publications,
1974-1997

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by date of creation or publication, whichever is noted. Contains articles and reviews written by Dr. Davies, both published and unpublished.

Subseries 4: Source Materials for Writings and Speeches, 1930-1996

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by folder title. Contains published materials found in Dr. Davies' files that appear to have been retained as source material for his articles and speeches. Arrangement was determined, in part, by the original order of the collection. Articles arranged in alphabetical order and by subject were maintained in these orders by Dr. Davies. Other materials are arranged by publication date.

Series III: External Activities,
1987-1996

arrangement.p: Comprised of five (5) subseries: Kentucky Centers of Excellence and Endowed Chairs; State of Louisiana -- Desegregation Settlement Agreement Monitoring Committee; Virginia Commonwealth University, University Honors Program; Mary Sue Terry Gubernatorial Campaign, and Nepal. Contains correspondence, clippings and other materials related to Dr. Davies' activities outside of SCHEV as a consultant and educator.

did.unittitle:
Subseries 1: Kentucky Centers of Excellence and Endowed Chairs,
1987-1993

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by date. Contains correspondence, notes and reports generated by the committee formed by the Kentucky Council on Higher Education to investigate the procedures and effectiveness of the Kentucky Centers of Excellence and the Endowed Chairs Program.

Subseries 2: State of Louisiana-Desegration Settlement Agreement Monitoring Committee,
1988-1996

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by date. Contains correspondence, notes and reports generated by the three-member committee formed by Louisiana Board of Regents to ensure the compliance of the State of Louisiana in regards to the ruling of the United States Supreme Court.

Subseries 3: Virginia Commonwealth University, University Honors Program,
1989-1990

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically. Contains materials used in preparing the course Dr. Davies taught at Virginia Commonwealth University (VCU) in the University Honors Program during the 1989/90 school year titled, Continuity and Change.

did.unittitle: Virginia Commonwealth University, University Honors Program, 1989/90 Course Materials

Subseries 4: Mary Sue Terry Gubernatorial Campaign,
1990-1993

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by date. Contains correspondence, notes, position papers and reports related to Ms. Terry's gubernatorial campaign in 1993.

did.unittitle:
Mary Sue Terry Gubernatorial Campaign,
1990-1993

Subseries 5: Nepal,
1991-1996

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by date. Contains correspondence, notes and other materials related to Dr. Davies' visit to Nepal as a member of a National Governor's Association team to assist officials in Nepal identify possible improvements to the Nepalese higher education system.

did.unittitle: National Governors' Association Center for Policy Research, Nepal
Series IV: Termination of Director of SCHEV, 1997

arrangement.p: Divided into three subseries: correspondence; clippings; and notes. All subseries are arranged chronologically. Includes correspondence, memos, newspaper accounts, and other materials relating to the April 1997 action of the Council to not renew Dr. Davies' contract.

did.unittitle:
Subseries 1: Correspondence,
1996-1997

arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically by date. Contains correspondence with the Council before and after the Council's decision to not renew Dr. Davies' contact and letters to Dr. Davies regarding the action taken by the Council.
